title: Akasol starts up battery production at new plant in Darmstadt
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project, named 'Gigafactory 1', is located at the headquarters of Akasol in Darmstadt, Germany.

Capacity:
- The production lines currently offer a production capacity of one gigawatt-hour (GWh).
- Expansion to adjacent areas is planned with a potential capacity of up to 5 GWh per year, which would be enough for 10,000 electric buses and trucks.

Investment amounts:
- Akasol has invested 100 million euros at the site for the production facility.

Project progress:
- Akasol had moved into the new headquarters in October 2020 and started production with an initial one GWh. The ceremonial opening of the plant did not take place last autumn due to pandemic-related restrictions.
- With the addition of new production lines, a capacity of 2.5 GWh is expected to be reached in 2022, with up to five gigawatt-hours possible depending on customer demand.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it involves the construction of a highly automated and advanced production facility for lithium-ion battery modules and systems.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers the stages of cell fabrication, module assembly, and equipping with controllers and cooling systems. The cells come from Samsung SDI and are assembled into modules and packs on-site.

This summarizes the key information from the articles related to the battery production project in Europe.

title: Akasol’s new plant in Darmstadt will have fully automated production lines by Manz
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Darmstadt, Germany, approximately 30 km from Frankfurt.

Capacity:
- The Gigafactory 1 in Darmstadt is planned to have a total capacity of up to 5 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- The company is investing around EUR 60 million in the infrastructure of the new corporate headquarters and Gigafactory 1 in Darmstadt.

Project progress:
- The Gigafactory 1 is expected to be inaugurated by the middle of 2021.
- The company has commissioned the production equipment manufacturer Manz AG to supply the first fully automated module production lines for the Gigafactory 1.
- The investment focus in the next few months will be on the construction of the new headquarters, including a test and validation center, main administration building, and space for up to 500 workplaces.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the construction of the Gigafactory 1 in Darmstadt.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of battery module production, as the first fully automated module production lines are being supplied for the Gigafactory 1.

title: Akasol Notes Dynamic Growth Of Demand For EV Batteries In U.S.
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Hazel Park, Michigan, USA, for the first North American production site. Additionally, there is an expansion of manufacturing capacity in Germany, with an expanded plant in Langen and a new plant in Darmstadt.

Capacity:
- The facility in Hazel Park, Michigan is initially planned to have an output of 400 MWh annually, with plans to expand to 2 GWh annually by 2023. The expanded plant in Langen, Germany, has a capacity of 800 MWh annually, and the new plant in Darmstadt aims for 2 GWh annually by H2 2021.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- Construction of the facility in Hazel Park, Michigan began in H1 2020 and is expected to be operational later this year. The expansion in Germany includes an expanded plant in Langen and the construction of a new plant in Darmstadt, with a goal for 2 GWh annually by H2 2021.

Project type:
- The project in Hazel Park, Michigan is a new build, while the expansion in Germany involves both an expansion of an existing plant and the construction of a new plant.
